description:
Responsibilities

  • Oversee the maintenance and repair of company vehicles and equipment.
  • Coordinate with terminal leaders to schedule repairs and maintenance of trucks, trailers, chassis, and box trucks.
  • Oversee outsourcing of equipment repairs, including tire service, scheduled PM services, needed repairs resulting from DVIR pre and post trip inspections and more by utilizing selected national account vendors.
  • Ensure compliance with DOT and CHP safety regulations and standards.
  • Aid in developing and implementing preventive maintenance programs for all fleet assets.
  • Monitor fuel consumption, mileage, and other performance metrics.
  • Monitor Samsara telematic devices to ensure proper working operation as well as asset utilization compliance.
  • Manage inventory of spare parts, tools, and supplies
  • Conduct regular inspections to identify potential issues or areas for improvement.
  • Conduct spot audits of Annual and 90 Day Inspections throughout the Fleet.
  • Aid in fleet operations, including vehicle acquisition and offboarding.
  • Manage regional fleet maintenance of Fleet Size of 150+ units (Trucks, Trailers, Chassis, Box Trucks)
  • Maintain accurate records of all maintenance activities. Maintain and upkeep Maintenance Files.
  • Develop and implement strategies to optimize utilization and cost -efficiency.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
  • Thrives in a fast-paced, high growth environment, is an independent, hands-on problem solver at different levels that take clear ownership of tasks.
  • Conducts part purchasing as needed to reduce vendor outsourcing cost of repairs. Also purchase oil, antifreeze, washer solvent act for terminal leaders.
  • Works in close coordination with the Vice President of maintenance to schedule and arrange equipment moves.
  • Monitors actual costs versus budget costs.
  • Ensure all repair orders are completed and processed in accordance with guidelines; approve regional maintenance expenditures and submit invoices for approval/payment.
  • Minimize fleet downtime and units out of service.
  • Ensure warranty submissions meet or exceed the business plan and are properly submitted.
  • Travel required.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in fleet management or related field.
  • Demonstrated experience overseeing maintenance and repair operations for a large fleet, preferably in the transportation or logistics industry.
  • Comprehensive understanding of DOT and CHP safety regulations and standards.
  • Proficiency in utilizing telematics systems, such as Samsara, for monitoring and optimizing fleet performance.
  • Familiarity with preventive maintenance programs and strategies to ensure optimal asset utilization and cost-efficiency.
  • Strong mechanical aptitude and understanding of vehicle systems and components.
  • Proven ability to lead and manage a team effectively.
  • Experience coordinating with terminal leaders and external vendors to schedule repairs and maintenance activities.
  • Ability to conduct inspections and audits to identify issues and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, to liaise with internal stakeholders, vendors, and management.
  • Ability to clearly articulate maintenance needs, budget requirements, and performance metrics to senior leadership.
